snippet: Executives at a wide range of companies fear paralysis in Washington will force hundreds of billions in tax increases and budget cuts in January, leading them to cancel new investments and put off new hires.
abstract: Rising number of manufacturers are canceling new investments and putting off new hires because they fear paralysis in Washington will force hundreds of billions in tax increases and budget cuts in January, undermining economic growth in the coming months.
lead_paragraph: Executives at a wide range of companies fear paralysis in Washington will force hundreds of billions in tax increases and budget cuts in January, leading them to cancel new investments and put off new hires.

headline.seo: Fear of ‘Fiscal Cliff’ Has Industry Pulling Back
headline.main: Fearing an Impasse in Congress, Industry Cuts Spending
headline.print_headline: Partisan Impasse Drives Industry To Cut Spending
